# Yamcs Overview

[Yamcs](https://yamcs.org/) is an open-source software for real-time mission control, providing tools for managing spacecraft and ground systems operations. 

## Key Features
- **Telemetry Processing**: Receives and processes telemetry data in real-time.
- **Telecommands**: Allows sending commands to satellites or spacecraft.
- **Alarms & Notifications**: Generates alarms based on configurable thresholds.
- **Data Replay**: Enables users to replay mission data.
- **Standards Compliance**: Supports standards like CCSDS, CFDP, and XTCE.

## Getting Started
To set up Yamcs, follow the [Getting Started Guide](https://yamcs.org/getting-started). It covers installation, configuration, and basic usage, ideal for new users.

## Python Client
The [Python Yamcs Client](https://docs.yamcs.org/python-yamcs-client/) allows integration with Yamcs via Python, supporting telemetry retrieval, commanding, and historical data access, making it suitable for custom mission applications.

## Extensions and Support
Yamcs is Java-based and extendable. Space Applications Services offers professional support, custom development, and training.
